definitions.definition: A shedding of tears; the act of crying.
definitions.example: After we broke up, I retreated to my room for a good cry.
I heard a cry from afar.

definitions.definition: (by extension) A pack or company of people.
(of an animal) A typical sound made by the species in question.
definitions.example: "Woof" is the cry of a dog, while "neigh" is the cry of a horse.
That sad movie always makes me cry.

definitions.definition: To utter loudly; to call out; to declare publicly.
To utter inarticulate sounds, as animals do.
To cause to do something, or bring to some state, by crying or weeping.
definitions.example: Tonight I'll cry myself to sleep.

definitions.definition: To make oral and public proclamation of; to notify or advertise by outcry, especially things lost or found, goods to be sold, etc.
Hence, to publish the banns of, as for marriage.
